AutoScroller is a utility class to send a large known block of predfined text to the glasses to be smoothly scrolled.
This is simlar to what is seen on a teleprompter or in movie credits.
This class was written using the
commands and is nothing more than a convience class.
Everything used this class can be written from the public SDK.
It scrolls the text much like a teleprompter would with basic commands to pause and resume the scrolling.
The duration (speed) of the scrolling can be modified while scrolling by seting the
property.
It can support any language that the font supports.
If the content is not known up front, or subject to change, this is the utility class will not work (use
instance instead).

When Ultralite.requestControl with a .scroll layout type .. this is the class you interate with to draw scrolling text to the screen.
Once the layout is .scrolled you must send one configure message to tell the layout how to setup.  It will setup the slice height and how many slices are visible.
There are two supported modes: autoScroll on/off
When autoScroll is true, the slices are automatically scrolled.  Subscribe to the delgate and listen for the scrolled callback, when you get it send another slice of text
When autoScroll is false, you can drive the slices and how they look on the screen.  You can send all the slices at once or send one at a time and animate it onto the screen at the current time.
Use this SDK to easily send text and images to your Vuxix smart glasses.
